card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If a player takes control of this card away from you, you do not lose 20 life because the loss of 20 life is a separate ability. That player is now subject to the loss.

card.name: Imposing Visage
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
card.flavor:
"I can't believe they expect me to fight with this rabble. A Goblin in a big mask sends ‘em running for cover."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

card.name: Incinerate
card.ability: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
card.flavor:
"Yes, I think ‘toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
card.ruling: 7/15/2007 : Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

card.name: Infernal Darkness
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay {B} and 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces {B} instead of any other type.
card.flavor:
"I thought the day had brought enough horrors for our ragged band, but the night was far worse."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This effect changes the type of mana produced, but not the amount. For example, if a land that's tapped for mana would add {W}{W} to its controller's mana pool, it adds {B}{B} to that player's mana pool instead.

card.name: Infernal Denizen
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice two Swamps. If you can't, tap Infernal Denizen, and an opponent may gain control of a creature you control of his or her choice for as long as Infernal Denizen remains on the battlefield.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as Infernal Denizen remains on the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You must sacrifice the Swamps if you can. You can't choose not to pay if you have them.
10/4/2004 : You should always have one creature for your opponent to take (i.e. the Denizen). If by chance you have no creature for your opponent to take, then they don't get one. Remember that taking a creature is optional so your opponent is not forced to take the Denizen.

card.name: Infinite Hourglass
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Infinite Hourglass.
All creatures get +1/+0 for each time counter on Infinite Hourglass.
{3}: Remove a time counter from Infinite Hourglass. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

card.name: Infuse
card.ability:
Untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"The potential for change lies in all things. Know a thing's nature, know its possibilities, and know it anew."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : You may target any artifact, creature, or land, not just a tapped one. If the targeted permanent is already untapped as Infuse resolves, Infuse won't affect it, but you'll still draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Jester's Cap
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Cap: Search target player's library for three cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor:
"Know your foes' strengths as well as their weaknesses."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the player has less than 3 cards in their library, just exile all the cards that are there.

card.name: Jester's Mask
card.ability:
Jester's Mask enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Mask: Target opponent puts the cards from his or her hand on top of his or her library. Search that player's library for that many cards. That player puts those cards into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

card.name: Jeweled Amulet
card.ability:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Jeweled Amulet. Note the type of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Activate this ability only if there are no charge counters on Jeweled Amulet.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Jeweled Amulet: Add one mana of Jeweled Amulet's last noted type to your mana pool.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.
10/1/2008 : Charge counters are indistinguishable from one another. If some other spell or ability (such as Power Conduit's ability) puts a charge counter on Jeweled Amulet, activating Jeweled Amulet's second ability will still check the type of mana last noted by its first ability. If there is no type of mana noted by its first ability (because it hasn't been activated by that point), the second ability will produce no mana.

card.name: Johtull Wurm
card.ability: Whenever Johtull Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -2/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
card.flavor:
"To bring her down we must be on all sides at once—leave one avenue open and we'll all be dead."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

card.name: Jokulhaups
card.ability: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"I was shocked when I first saw the aftermath of the Yavimaya Valley disaster. The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

card.name: Juniper Order Druid
card.ability: {T}: Untap target land.
card.flavor:
"The filthy towns of Kjeldor are no place for anyone to live. Fyndhorn is our home now."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

card.name: Justice
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Justice unless you pay {W}{W}.
Whenever a red creature or spell deals damage, Justice deals that much damage to that creature's or spell's controller.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a single source does damage to multiple targets at once, Justice will add up all the damage done and deal damage to the source's controller at one time (not multiple separate damagings).
10/4/2004 : The damage done by Justice is done as a triggered ability, which is added to the stack just after the red creature or spell deals its damage.

card.name: Karplusan Forest
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Karplusan Giant
card.ability: Tap an untapped snow land you control: Karplusan Giant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of Giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

card.name: Karplusan Yeti
card.ability: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.
card.flavor:
"What's that smell?"
—Perena Deepcutter,
Dwarven Armorer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Giving either creature first strike does not affect the ability.
10/4/2004 : If this leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, it will still deal damage to the targeted creature. On the other hand, if the targeted creature leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability will be countered and no damage will be dealt.

card.name: Kelsinko Ranger
card.ability: {1}{W}: Target green creature gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Rangers not trained by the Elves just aren't the same."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

card.name: Kjeldoran Dead
card.ability:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.
card.flavor:
"They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice is a triggered ability and not a cost.
10/1/2008 : When Kjeldoran Dead's enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, if you don't control any other creatures, you must sacrifice Kjeldoran Dead itself.

card.name: Kjeldoran Elite Guard
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Kjeldoran Elite Guard. Activate this ability only during combat.
card.flavor: The winged helms of the Guard are put on for pageants—but taken off for war.

card.name: Kjeldoran Frostbeast
card.ability: At end of combat, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by Kjeldoran Frostbeast.
card.flavor:
"Two of my Warriors found that the creature was dangerous not only in combat, but also in simple proximity."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : Kjeldoran Frostbeast's ability triggers only if it's still on the battlefield when the end of combat step begins (after the combat damage step). For example, if it blocks a 7/7 creature and is destroyed, its ability won't trigger at all. The 7/7 will remain on the battlefield.
10/1/2009 : Its ability will destroy all creatures it's currently blocking or blocked by, not necessarily the creatures it had blocked or become blocked by during that combat phase. For example, if Kjeldoran Frostbeast is dealt lethal combat damage and regenerates, it's removed from combat. Its ability will trigger at end of combat, but since it's no longer blocking or blocked by any creatures, the ability won't do anything.

card.name: Kjeldoran Guard
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Kjeldoran Guard. Activate this ability only during combat and only if defending player controls no snow lands.

card.name: Kjeldoran Knight
card.ability:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
{1}{W}: Kjeldoran Knight gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Kjeldoran Knight gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Those who do not ride the wind on Aesthir still command loyalty and respect."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Kjeldoran Phalanx
card.ability: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"There's nothing I like better than watching a street full of soldiers kicking down the doors of the guilty and the impure."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
card.ability: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
card.flavor:
"Honorable in battle,
generous in death."
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you activate the ability but Kjeldoran Royal Guard leaves the battlefield before combat damage is dealt, the combat damage from unblocked creatures won't be redirected. It will be dealt to you as normal.

card.name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
card.ability: Flying; first strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"If we do our duty and uphold our honor, Kjeldor shall stand for a thousand years."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Kjeldoran Skyknight
card.ability: Flying; first strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"My Aesthir is my most trusted ally. We fight as one and live as one, and we will die as one."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Kjeldoran Warrior
card.ability: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"Give me a thousand such Warriors and I could change the world."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Knight of Stromgald
card.ability:
Protection from white
{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Kjeldorans should rule supreme, and to the rest, death"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

card.name: Krovikan Elementalist
card.ability:
{2}{R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{U}{U}: Target creature you control gains flying until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"The Elementalists' talents could be useful if turned to other purposes."
—Zur the Enchanter

card.name: Krovikan Fetish
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Krovikan Fetish enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
card.flavor: Some Krovikans find strength in the ears and eyes of their victims and wear such fetishes into battle.
card.ruling:
8/1/2005 : You do not get a card if the target becomes illegal and Krovikan Fetish is countered upon resolution. This is because it never successfully enters the battlefield.
8/1/2005 : If it is moved to a new creature by something that moves Auras, the controller of the Fetish does not get to draw another card.

card.name: Krovikan Sorcerer
card.ability:
{T}, Discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{T}, Discard a black card: Draw two cards, then discard one of them.
card.flavor:
"These Sorcerers always seem to have another surprise up their sleeves."
—Zur the Enchanter

card.name: Krovikan Vampire
card.ability: At the beginning of each end step, if a creature dealt damage by Krovikan Vampire this turn died, put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Sacrifice it when you lose control of Krovikan Vampire.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability triggers at end of turn. At that time, the game checks all creatures put into graveyards from the battlefield that turn to see if Krovikan Vampire had dealt damage to them during the turn. It doesn't matter whether the damage was combat damage, and it doesn't matter whether the damage was what caused the creatures to be put into the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : If a creature that the Vampire dealt damage to is put into a graveyard, then leaves the graveyard by some means, the game loses track of it. The Vampire's ability won't be able to return it to the battlefield, even if it's put back into the graveyard before the end of the turn.
8/1/2008 : Whoever controls the Vampire at the time the ability triggers will return the applicable cards to the battlefield under his or her control. It doesn't matter who controlled the Vampire at the time the damage was dealt.
8/1/2008 : If the Vampire isn't on the battlefield by the time the end step begins, its ability won't trigger. No cards will be returned to the battlefield, even if the Vampire dealt damage to some creatures put into the graveyard that turn.
10/1/2008 : If a creature that the Vampire dealt damage to that turn is put into a graveyard from the battlefield during a turn's End step (after any "at the beginning of the end step" triggers would have triggered that turn), that card won't be returned to the battlefield.

card.name: Land Cap
card.ability:
Land Cap doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a depletion counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a depletion counter from Land Cap.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Put a depletion counter on Land Cap.

card.name: Lapis Lazuli Talisman
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, untap target permanent.

card.name: Lava Burst
card.ability: Lava Burst deals X damage to target creature or player. If Lava Burst would deal damage to a creature, that damage can't be prevented or dealt instead to another creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Overkill? This isn't a game of Kick-the-Ouphe"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Prevention and redirection effects will have no effect on damage dealt by Lava Burst to a creature. However, they will work on damage that Lava Burst would deal to a player.
10/1/2008 : A creature dealt damage by Lava Burst may be regenerated.

card.name: Lava Tubes
card.ability:
Lava Tubes doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a depletion counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a depletion counter from Lava Tubes.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Put a depletion counter on Lava Tubes.

card.name: Legions of Lim-Dûl
card.ability: Snow swampwalk
card.flavor:
"I have seen the faces of my dead friends among that grim band, and I can bear no more."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield.

card.name: Leshrac's Rite
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk.
card.flavor:
"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. I shall hunger for your word and thirst for your blessing. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Leshrac's Sigil
card.ability:
Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you may pay {B}{B}. If you do, look at that player's hand and choose a card from it. The player discards that card.
{B}{B}: Return Leshrac's Sigil to its owner's hand.

card.name: Lhurgoyf
card.ability: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
card.flavor:
"Ach Hans, run It's the Lhurgoyf"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Lightning Blow
card.ability:
Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"If you do it right, they'll never know what hit them."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : You may target any creature, not just one that doesn't have first strike. If the targeted creature already has first strike as Lightning Blow resolves, Lightning Blow won't affect it (since multiple instances of first strike are redundant), but you'll still draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
10/1/2009 : If the targeted creature doesn't have first strike, granting it first strike after combat damage has been dealt in the first combat damage step won't prevent it from dealing combat damage. It will still assign and deal its combat damage in the second combat damage step.

card.name: Lim-Dûl's Cohort
card.ability: Whenever Lim-Dûl's Cohort blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature can't be regenerated this turn.
card.flavor:
"Join me in the place of power, you risen dead. Join me where the waters weep and the trees have no hearts."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Lim-Dûl's Hex
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, for each player, Lim-Dûl's Hex deals 1 damage to that player unless he or she pays {B} or {3}.
card.flavor:
"The weak shall fall. The strong shall remain."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Lost Order of Jarkeld
card.ability:
As Lost Order of Jarkeld enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Lost Order of Jarkeld's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of creatures the chosen player controls.
card.flavor:
"Let us remember brave Jarkeld and his troops, who perished in the Adarkar Wastes so long ago."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

card.name: Lure
card.ability:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
10/4/2004 : If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
10/4/2004 : The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

card.name: Maddening Wind
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Maddening Wind deals 2 damage to that player.
card.flavor:
"It is Freyalise, walking on the world."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

card.name: Magus of the Unseen
card.ability: {1}{U}, {T}: Untap target artifact an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the artifact, tap it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You may target an untapped artifact with this ability.
10/4/2004 : The artifact taps after returning to the opponent (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
10/1/2008 : You tap the artifact when you lose control of it for any reason -- because Magus of the Unseen's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.
10/1/2008 : The artifact will gain haste whether or not it's a creature. Of course, if it's not a creature, haste will have no particular effect.

card.name: Malachite Talisman
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, untap target permanent.

card.name: Márton Stromgald
card.ability:
Whenever Márton Stromgald attacks, other attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn for each attacking creature other than Márton Stromgald.
Whenever Márton Stromgald blocks, other blocking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn for each blocking creature other than Márton Stromgald.

card.name: Melee
card.ability:
Cast Melee only during your turn and only during combat before blockers are declared.
You choose which creatures block this combat and how those creatures block.
Whenever a creature attacks and isn't blocked this combat, untap it and remove it from combat.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Melting
card.ability: All lands are no longer snow.
card.flavor:
"Who needs the sun when you've got me around?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

card.name: Mercenaries
card.ability: {3}: The next time Mercenaries would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor:
"Blasted amateurs Doesn't the queen think we can fight well enough on our own?"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

card.name: Merieke Ri Berit
card.ability:
Merieke Ri Berit doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Merieke Ri Berit. When Merieke Ri Berit leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.ruling:
9/25/2006 : If Merieke becomes untapped, its "destroy" ability will trigger, but you won't lose control of the creature you took before it's destroyed.
9/25/2006 : If another player takes control of Merieke, you will immediately lose control of the creature you took, but Merieke's "destroy" ability won't trigger. The affected creature will go back under the control of the appropriate player.
9/25/2006 : If Merieke leaves the battlefield, you will immediately lose control of the creature you took and Merieke's "destroy" ability will trigger. The affected creature will go back under the control of the appropriate player, then it will be destroyed.

card.name: Mesmeric Trance
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Magic overused can freeze the mind. Creativity is more important than power."
—Zur the Enchanter

card.name: Meteor Shower
card.ability: Meteor Shower deals X plus 1 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
card.flavor:
"Eenie, meenie, minie, moe . . . oh, why not all of them?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can't choose to do fractional damage to a target.
10/1/2008 : A tip on how this math works:To deal a total of 1 damage, X is 0. The cost is {0} + {0} + {R} = {R}.To deal a total of 2 damage, X is 1. The cost is {1} + {1} + {R} = {2}{R}.To deal a total of 3 damage, X is 2. The cost is {2} + {2} + {R} = {4}{R}.And so on.
10/1/2008 : The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most X + 1. You divide the damage as you cast Meteor Shower, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

card.name: Mind Ravel
card.ability:
Target player discards a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor: An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You still draw a card if opponent had no cards in hand.

card.name: Mind Warp
card.ability: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The target player decides what order to put the cards in the graveyard. You decide which cards, but they do the discarding.

card.name: Mind Whip
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {3}. If he or she doesn't, Mind Whip deals 2 damage to that player and you tap that creature.
card.flavor: "A mind in agony is a sparrow without wings."Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Minion of Leshrac
card.ability:
Protection from black
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Leshrac deals 5 damage to you unless you sacrifice a creature other than Minion of Leshrac. If Minion of Leshrac deals damage to you this way, tap it.
{T}: Destroy target creature or land.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If you don't sacrifice a creature at the beginning of your upkeep (either by choice or because you can't), but you somehow prevent all the damage Minion of Leshrac would deal to you, then you don't tap Minion of Leshrac.
10/1/2008 : Minion of Leshrac can't target itself with its activated ability because it has protection from black.

card.name: Minion of Tevesh Szat
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Tevesh Szat deals 2 damage to you unless you pay {B}{B}.
{T}: Target creature gets +3/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"A minion given over to Tevesh Szat is a stronger minion gained."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Mistfolk
card.ability: {U}: Counter target spell that targets Mistfolk.
card.flavor:
"Although my official log will state there is no evidence pointing to the existence of the Mistfolk, my certainty is lessened by the cursed consistency of the expedition's eyewitness accounts."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

card.name: Mole Worms
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Mole Worms during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target land. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Mole Worms remains tapped.

card.name: Monsoon
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's end step, tap all untapped Islands that player controls and Monsoon deals X damage to the player, where X is the number of Islands tapped this way.
card.flavor:
"No one in her right mind would venture off the coast of Kjeldor during this season."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

card.name: Moor Fiend
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor:
"Let them close the gates of Krov from dusk until dawn if they so choose. It matters not. My fiends shall yet rend their flesh from their bones."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Mountain Goat
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor:
"Folklore has it that to capture a Mountain Goat is a sign of divine blessing. I just know it's a sign that dinner is on the way."
—Klazina Jansdotter, Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

card.name: Mountain Titan
card.ability: {1}{R}{R}: Until end of turn, whenever you cast a black spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Mountain Titan.
card.flavor:
"The Titans claimed to draw strength from the rocks, but I suspect them of some darker allegiance."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

card.name: Mudslide
card.ability:
Creatures without flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped creatures without flying he or she controls and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : First the player chooses all the tapped creatures he or she would like to untap this way. Then the entire payment is made at once, then all of those creatures untap at the same time. If the entire payment can't be paid (because the player chose too many creatures, for example), none of it is paid and none of those creatures untap.

card.name: Musician
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Put a music counter on target creature. If it doesn't have "At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy this creature unless you pay {1} for each music counter on it," it gains that ability.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.
10/1/2008 : This ability has no duration. An affected creature will retain the triggered ability until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect causes it to lose its abilities. It doesn't matter if Musician is still on the battlefield or not.
10/1/2008 : Although a creature can gain the triggered ability only once, it can be targeted by multiple Musicians to increase its number of music counters.
10/1/2008 : If a music counter is put on a creature by some other means (Fate Transfer, for example), but that creature has never been affected by Musician's ability, that creature won't have the triggered ability and its controller won't have to pay mana. The music counters will stay on that creature but won't do anything.

card.name: Mystic Might
card.ability:
Enchant land you control
Cumulative upkeep {1}{U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn."

card.name: Mystic Remora
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, you may draw a card unless that player pays {4}.
card.ruling:
9/16/2007 : First the opponent chooses whether or not to pay {4}. Then, if he or she doesn't pay, you choose whether or not to draw a card.
4/1/2008 : A "noncreature spell" is any spell that doesn't have the type Creature. Artifact Creatures, Enchantment Creatures, and older cards of type Summon are all creature spells.

card.name: Nacre Talisman
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, untap target permanent.

card.name: Naked Singularity
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If tapped for mana, Plains produce {R}, Islands produce {G}, Swamps produce {W}, Mountains produce {U}, and Forests produce {B} instead of any other type.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability generates a replacement effect.
10/4/2004 : If a player uses a text-changing effect to make a land type be listed as producing two different colors, the player tapping the land for mana can choose to produce mana of either color. But if it produces more than one mana, all mana is of the same color.
4/15/2013 : If a land has more than one basic land type, the player tapping the land for mana can choose to produce mana of either color. But if it produces more than one mana, all mana is of the same color.

card.name: Nature's Lore
card.ability: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"Fyndhorn is our home."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
8/1/2008 : You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

card.name: Necropotence
card.ability:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Removing Necropotence from the battlefield will not stop the cards from the life-payment ability from being put into your hand in the end step.

card.name: Norritt
card.ability:
{T}: Untap target blue creature.
{T}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That creature attacks this turn if able. If it doesn't, destroy it at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only before attackers are declared.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creature is destroyed if it does not attack because it simply can't do so legally.

card.name: Oath of Lim-Dûl
card.ability:
Whenever you lose life, for each 1 life you lost, sacrifice a permanent other than Oath of Lim-Dûl unless you discard a card. (Damage dealt to you causes you to lose life.)
{B}{B}: Draw a card.

card.name: Onyx Talisman
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, untap target permanent.

card.name: Orcish Cannoneers
card.ability: {T}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
card.flavor:
"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

card.name: Orcish Conscripts
card.ability:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.

card.name: Orcish Farmer
card.ability: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor:
"Yes, the Farmers keep our soldiers fed. But why do they have to make every battlefield a pigpen?"
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This ability changes the targeted land's land types. It doesn't affect its name, its supertypes (such as whether or not it's legendary, snow, or basic), or its other types (if it's also a creature, for example). The ability will cause the land to lose all of its printed abilities and gain the ability "{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool."

card.name: Orcish Healer
card.ability:
{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
{B}{B}{R}, {T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.
{R}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.

card.name: Orcish Librarian
card.ability: {R}, {T}: Look at the top eight cards of your library. Exile four of them at random, then put the rest on top of your library in any order.
card.flavor:
Us hungry, need food . . . .
Lots of books . . . . Hmm . . . .
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You do get to look at the remaining 4 cards before deciding which order to put them back in.

card.name: Orcish Lumberjack
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"How did I ever let myself get talked into this project?"
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

card.name: Orcish Squatters
card.ability: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability triggers on the declaration of blockers if no blockers are declared for it.
10/1/2008 : If you lose control of Orcish Squatters before its ability resolves, you won't gain control of the targeted land at all.
4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Order of the Sacred Torch
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.

card.name: Order of the White Shield
card.ability:
Protection from black
{W}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Shall we turn away a worthy soul because his parents were peasants? I think not."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

card.name: Pale Bears
card.ability: Islandwalk
card.flavor:
"Daughter, on the day you have killed your Pale Bear, then will I give you your true name."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

card.name: Panic
card.ability:
Cast Panic only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"If you'd been there, you would've run from that deer, too"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

card.name: Pentagram of the Ages
card.ability: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor:
"Take this item, for instance. How would it destroy us, Relicbane?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Pestilence Rats
card.ability: Pestilence Rats's power is equal to the number of other Rats on the battlefield. (For example, as long as there are two other Rats on the battlefield, Pestilence Rats's power and toughness are 2/3.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Does not count itself for determining power. It only counts other Rats.

card.name: Phantasmal Mount
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target creature you control with toughness 2 or less gets +1/+1 and gains flying until end of turn. When Phantasmal Mount leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice that creature. When the creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Phantasmal Mount.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : If the ability resolves, then the targeted creature's toughness becomes greater than 2 later, Phantasmal Mount's effect will not end. (The ability checks whether the creature has toughness 2 or less only at the time you activate it and the time it resolves.)

card.name: Pit Trap
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"These traps are truly a symbol of great cruelty and sinister cunning."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

card.name: Polar Kraken
card.ability:
Trample
Polar Kraken enters the battlefield tapped.
Cumulative upkeep—Sacrifice a land. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
card.flavor:
"It was big. Really, really, big. No, bigger than that. It was big"
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

card.name: Portent
card.ability:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle his or her library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This does not cause a player to lose if they have less than 3 cards in their library. It allows you to look at and reorder or shuffle whatever remaining cards there might be.

card.name: Power Sink
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.
10/4/2004 : When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.
3/1/2010 : Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tappped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

card.name: Pox
card.ability: Each player loses a third of his or her life, then discards a third of the cards in his or her hand, then sacrifices a third of the creatures he or she controls, then sacrifices a third of the lands he or she controls. Round up each time.
card.ruling:
9/16/2007 : The losses, discards, and sacrifices are rounded up. For example, if you have 5 life, you'll lose 2 life, leaving you at 3 life. (Five divided by three is one and two-thirds. Rounding that up to the nearest whole number gives you two.)
9/16/2007 : Each part of Pox's effect is processed separately. For each part, first the player whose turn it is makes all necessary choices (such as which cards to discard), then each other player in turn order chooses, then the actions happen at the same time. Then Pox's effect moves to the next stage.
9/16/2007 : The number you need to lose, discard, or sacrifice isn't calculated until it's time to perform that part of the effect. For example, if your opponent casts Pox and you discard Dodecapod as part of Pox's discard effect, Dodecapod will be put onto the battlefield instead of into your graveyard. Then, when determining how many creatures you need to sacrifice, the Dodecapod is taken into account.

card.name: Prismatic Ward
card.ability:
Enchant creature
As Prismatic Ward enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the chosen color.
card.flavor: "These, of all spells, must have common components I can isolate and use."Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

card.name: Pygmy Allosaurus
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor:
"I don't understand the appeal of keeping these things as pets, unless you want your children eaten."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

card.name: Pyknite
card.ability: When Pyknite enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"Never cross a Pyknite, if you value your scalp."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

card.name: Pyroblast
card.ability: Choose one — Counter target spell if it's blue; or destroy target permanent if it's blue.
card.flavor:
"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.
9/16/2007 : You can change the text of this spell after announcing it to change the color that it will affect. This works, because the color isn't part of the targeting requirement.
9/16/2007 : Note that Pyroblast can target any spell or permanent, not just a blue one. It checks the color of the target only on resolution.
9/16/2007 : If there are no legal targets for either of the modes, you can't choose that mode.

card.name: Pyroclasm
card.ability: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
card.flavor:
"Leaves more room for the big ones to fight in, you know."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

card.name: Rally
card.ability: Blocking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Stand your ground, troops This shall be our finest hour"
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox, last words

card.name: Ray of Command
card.ability: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You may target an untapped creature with Ray of Command.
10/4/2004 : The creature returns to the opponent when the "until end of turn" effect wears off during the cleanup step. It taps during the Cleanup step (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
10/1/2008 : You tap the creature when you lose control of it for any reason -- because Ray of Command's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.

card.name: Ray of Erasure
card.ability:
Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"What is real can be unreal."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

card.name: Reality Twist
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1}{U}{U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If tapped for mana, Plains produce {R}, Swamps produce {G}, Mountains produce {W}, and Forests produce {B} instead of any other type.
card.flavor:
"Nothing is as it seems."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a player uses a text-changing effect to make a land type be listed as producing two different colors, the player tapping the land for mana can choose to produce mana of either color. But if it produces more than one mana, all mana is of the same color.
4/15/2013 : If a land has more than one basic land type, the player tapping the land for mana can choose to produce mana of either color. But if it produces more than one mana, all mana is of the same color.

card.name: Reclamation
card.ability: Black creatures can't attack unless their controller sacrifices a land for each black creature he or she controls that's attacking.
card.flavor:
"We shall oppose Lim-Dûl and his forces by any means necessary, even if the very earth be torn asunder."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

card.name: Red Scarab
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by red creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent controls a red permanent.

card.name: Regeneration
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.flavor:
"Faith in Freyalise has given me the gift, not the curse, of unprecedented longevity."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

card.name: Rime Dryad
card.ability: Snow forestwalk
card.flavor:
"The Dryads told us to stay, as no new horrors would come when it was so cold. Three of us left anyway. The rest believed their lies, and their skeletons weren't found until the thaw."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can't landwalk through a non-Snow Forest.

card.name: Ritual of Subdual
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.
card.flavor:
"That which does not bend to the will of Freyalise shall surely break."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This effect changes the type of mana produced, but not the amount. For example, if a land that's tapped for mana would add {W}{W} to its controller's mana pool, it adds {2} to that player's mana pool instead.

card.name: River Delta
card.ability:
River Delta doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a depletion counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a depletion counter from River Delta.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Put a depletion counter on River Delta.

card.name: Runed Arch
card.ability:
Runed Arch enters the battlefield tapped.
{X}, {T}, Sacrifice Runed Arch: X target creatures with power 2 or less are unblockable this turn.

card.name: Sabretooth Tiger
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor:
"Daughter, it is now your turn to hunt the Tiger, and make a blanket of its fur."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

card.name: Sacred Boon
card.ability: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
card.flavor:
"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

card.name: Scaled Wurm
card.flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these Wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

card.name: Sea Spirit
card.ability: {U}: Sea Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"It rose above our heads, above the ship, and still higher yet. No foggy, ice-laden sea in the world could frighten me more."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

card.name: Seizures
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Seizures deals 3 damage to that creature's controller unless that player pays {3}.
card.flavor:
"Sheathe your sword, warrior, lest ye fall on it when stricken."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Seraph
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Seraph this turn dies, put that card onto the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step. Sacrifice the creature when you lose control of Seraph.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You do not get the creature back if the creature is not still in the graveyard at the end of the turn.
9/16/2007 : If Seraph isn't on the battlefield at the time the other creature is put into a graveyard, the ability won't trigger. However, the ability does trigger if Seraph and the other creature are put into the graveyard at the same time.
9/16/2007 : If the other creature is a token, it will cease to exist after being exiled. It won't be returned to the battlefield.
9/16/2007 : If the other creature ceases to be a creature card after it leaves the battlefield (it's an animated Mishra's Factory, for example), it will be returned to the battlefield by this ability and you will have to sacrifice it when you lose control of Seraph.
9/16/2007 : Once the ability triggers, you'll return the card to the battlefield under your control at the end of the turn even if you no longer control Seraph at that time. In fact, if Seraph leaves the battlefield before the card is returned to the battlefield, you'll never have to sacrifice it as a result of this ability. If Seraph remains on the battlefield but changes controllers before the card is returned, you'll still get the returned card. However, in that scenario, you'll still have to sacrifice it if you later regain control Seraph and then lose control of it once more.

card.name: Shambling Strider
card.ability: {R}{G}: Shambling Strider gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Freyalise forbid that any stranger should wander into the Striders' territory.

card.name: Shatter
card.ability: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor:
"Let the past be the past. Do not call up that which you cannot put down. Destroy that which destroyed us, so long ago."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

card.name: Shield Bearer
card.ability: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a Skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Shield of the Ages
card.ability: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
card.flavor:
"This shield is a true rarity: an artifact whose purpose is obvious."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Shyft
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Shyft become the color or colors of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor:
"Capturing this specimen was not easy. Study it well, that you someday might be as versatile."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Shyft's ability won't let you make it colorless. Colorless is not a color.
10/1/2008 : The ability's effect has no duration. Shyft will remain the chosen color or colors until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect (such as the next time its ability resolves) changes its colors.

card.name: Sibilant Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Relax. I'm sure it's just a snake hissing."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Your opponent does not have to draw a card if they don't want to.

card.name: Silver Erne
card.ability: Flying, trample
card.flavor:
"I've seen a larger Erne knock a Giant to the ground and stay airborne. They move not with the wind, but as the wind."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

card.name: Skeleton Ship
card.ability:
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Skeleton Ship.
{T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor:
"The sea gives up her dead as easily as the soil."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Skull Catapult
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Let any who doubt the evil of using the ancient devices look at this infernal machine. What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

card.name: Sleight of Mind
card.ability: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell." This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can't Sleight proper nouns (i.e. card names). This means that you can't affect a "Black Vise".
10/4/2004 : Can target a card with no color words on it.
10/4/2004 : Can't change a color word to the same color word. It must be a different word.
10/4/2004 : Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
10/4/2004 : Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
10/4/2004 : It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
10/4/2004 : It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
10/4/2004 : You choose the words to change on resolution.
10/4/2004 : Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
10/4/2004 : If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.

card.name: Snow Devil
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature has first strike as long as it's blocking and you control a snow land.
card.flavor: "Give me wings to fly and speed to strike. In return, the glory I earn shall be yours."Steinar Icefist, Balduvian Shaman

card.name: Snow Fortress
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Snow Fortress gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{1}: Snow Fortress gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{3}: Snow Fortress deals 1 damage to target creature without flying that's attacking you.

card.name: Snow Hound
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Return Snow Hound and target green or blue creature you control to their owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"If you're starving, eat your horses, your dead, or yourself—but never eat your dog."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

card.name: Snowblind
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-Y. If that creature is attacking, X is the number of snow lands defending player controls. Otherwise, X is the number of snow lands its controller controls. Y is equal to X or to enchanted creature's toughness minus 1, whichever is smaller.

card.name: Snow-Covered Forest
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Snow-Covered Island
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Snow-Covered Mountain
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Snow-Covered Plains
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Snow-Covered Swamp
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Snowfall
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever an Island is tapped for mana, its controller may add {U} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces). If that Island is snow, its controller may add {U}{U} to his or her mana pool instead. Spend this mana only to pay cumulative upkeep costs.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : This mana is in addition to any mana the Island itself produces, and is blue regardless of what type of mana the Island produces.

card.name: Soldevi Golem
card.ability:
Soldevi Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may untap target tapped creature an opponent controls. If you do, untap Soldevi Golem.
card.flavor: Slow and steady wins the race.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability to untap a creature can be used even if the Golem is already untapped.

card.name: Soldevi Machinist
card.ability: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to activate abilities of artifacts.
card.flavor:
"Perhaps this time the power of the artificers shall be used wisely."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : Mana from the ability can only be spent on activation costs for abilities from artifacts. It can't be spent on artifact spells, or on costs resulting from triggered abilities.

card.name: Soldevi Simulacrum
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{1}: Soldevi Simulacrum gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
They look human—
until they bleed.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

card.name: Songs of the Damned
card.ability: Add {B} to your mana pool for each creature card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Not wind, but the breath of the dead.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Soul Barrier
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Soul Barrier deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she pays {2}.
card.flavor:
"There's more than one way to skin an Ouphe—or thwart a mage."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Soul Burn
card.ability:
Spend only black and/or red mana on X.
Soul Burn deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more than the amount of {B} spent on X, the player's life total before Soul Burn dealt damage, or the creature's toughness.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Will give 1 life for each black mana used, but not more life than the amount of unprevented damage that is dealt.

card.name: Soul Kiss
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{B}, Pay 1 life: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.

card.name: Spectral Shield
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and can't be the target of spells.
card.flavor:
"What can be a stronger shield than concealment? Have you ever defeated an enemy you didn't know existed?"
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The enchanted creature can still be the target of abilities.

card.name: Spoils of Evil
card.ability: For each artifact or creature card in target opponent's graveyard, add {1} to your mana pool and you gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Virtue has its rewards, as does its opposite."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The text "for each artifact or creature" means the sum of cards which are either creature and/or artifact. Artifact creatures are not double counted.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Spoils of War
card.ability:
X is the number of artifact and/or creature cards in an opponent's graveyard as you cast Spoils of War.
Distribute X +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.
card.flavor:
"This is the fun part"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
8/1/2008 : X is set as you cast the spell to be exactly the number of appropriate cards in an opponent's graveyard. You can't choose a higher or lower value for X.

card.name: Staff of the Ages
card.ability: Creatures with landwalk abilities can be blocked as though they didn't have those abilities.
card.flavor:
"We found this staff useful on our visit to this very commission. Would Relicbane prefer we had been slain by Lim-Dûl's horrors?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It does not remove Landwalk from creatures. It just makes creatures with landwalk blockable as if they did not have the ability.

card.name: Stampede
card.ability: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"We could see the horizon blacken with the great beasts, but it was too late. The icefield offered no immediate safety, but luckily most of us reached a crevasse in which we could take cover."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

card.name: Stench of Evil
card.ability: Destroy all Plains. For each land destroyed this way, Stench of Evil deals 1 damage to that land's controller unless he or she pays {2}.

card.name: Stone Rain
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor:
"May the forces that took Argoth beneath the waves never come among us again."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Stone Spirit
card.ability: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
card.flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) can block this because they don’t actually have Flying.

card.name: Stonehands
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Trust in the power of stone. Stone is strong; stone shatters swords; stone breaks bones. Trust in stone."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

card.name: Storm Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Storm Spirit deals 2 damage to target creature.
card.flavor:
"Come to us, with your lightning. Come to us, with your thunder. Serve us with your strength, and smite our foes with your power."
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian Shaman

card.name: Stormbind
card.ability: {2}, Discard a card at random: Stormbind deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Once, our people could call down the storm itself to do our bidding."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Since the discard is a cost, it can't be used with Library of Leng.

card.name: Stromgald Cabal
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
card.flavor:
"Kjeldor must be supreme at any cost."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

card.name: Stunted Growth
card.ability: Target player chooses three cards from his or her hand and puts them on top of his or her library in any order.

card.name: Sulfurous Springs
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Sunstone
card.ability: {2}, Sacrifice a snow land: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.flavor:
"I dispute Relicbane's hysterical allegations, Commissioner, but it is true that these artifacts can be dangerous."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Swords to Plowshares
card.ability: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
card.flavor:
"The so-called Barbarians will not respect us for our military might—they will respect us for our honor."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the creature has a negative power, the player does not lose life. It acts the same as if it had a power of zero.
10/1/2008 : The amount of life that's gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

card.name: Tarpan
card.ability: When Tarpan dies, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"A good Tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

card.name: Thermokarst
card.ability: Destroy target land. If that land was a snow land, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Finally we understand the lesson of our home: loss begets renewal."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

card.name: Thoughtleech
card.ability: Whenever an Island an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"A resourceful mage has many sources of information. The best one is your foe."
—Zur the Enchanter

card.name: Thunder Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
{U}: Thunder Wall gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The Lemures had barely taken wing when the sky roared with thunder. The swarm of little beasts wavered, divided, and fell, crashing to the earth."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

card.name: Timberline Ridge
card.ability:
Timberline Ridge doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a depletion counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a depletion counter from Timberline Ridge.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Put a depletion counter on Timberline Ridge.

card.name: Time Bomb
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage equal to the number of time counters on it to each creature and each player.

card.name: Tinder Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
{R}, Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Tinder Wall deals 2 damage to target creature it's blocking.

card.name: Tor Giant
card.flavor:
"What do you do then? Run. Run very fast. Don't stop until you see the camp—or a bigger Giant."
—Toothlicker Harj,
Orcish Captain

card.name: Total War
card.ability: Whenever a player attacks with one or more creatures, destroy all untapped non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack, except for creatures the player hasn't controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Destroys creatures as a triggered ability on the declaration of attackers.

card.name: Touch of Death
card.ability:
Touch of Death deals 1 damage to target player. You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your life."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Touch of Vitae
card.ability:
Until end of turn, target creature gains haste and "{0}: Untap this creature. Activate this ability only once."
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Trailblazer
card.ability: Target creature is unblockable this turn.
card.flavor:
"Our Elvish Hunter Taaveti led us swiftly along hidden paths through the dense forest. We caught the Orcs from behind, and completely by surprise."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

card.name: Underground River
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Updraft
card.ability:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"The power of flight has but one equal in battle: surprise. Understanding how to use both is the key to victory."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

card.name: Urza's Bauble
