card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Urza's Bauble: Look at a card at random in target player's hand. You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Veldt
card.ability:
Veldt doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a depletion counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a depletion counter from Veldt.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Put a depletion counter on Veldt.

card.name: Venomous Breath
card.ability: Choose target creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by it this turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It affects creatures that had blocked the target when this spell resolves, even if they are no longer blocking the creature.

card.name: Vertigo
card.ability: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I saw the wizard gesturing, but I didn't guess his plan until my Aesthir cried out and went into a dive."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

card.name: Vexing Arcanix
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player names a card, then reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's the named card, the player puts it into his or her hand. Otherwise, the player puts it into his or her graveyard and Vexing Arcanix deals 2 damage to him or her.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the player has no cards in their library, the effect does nothing. It does not cause any damage.
10/4/2004 : The target player names a card on resolution.

card.name: Vibrating Sphere
card.ability:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get -0/-2.
card.flavor:
"Unearthly and invisible fibers emanate from this sphere, entangling all who draw near."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Any creature which is lowered below a toughness of 1 will die at the beginning of the upkeep step, since that is the first time State-Based Actions are checked.

card.name: Walking Wall
card.ability:
Defender
{3}: Walking Wall gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor:
"The fortress is not what it seems."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Wall of Lava
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Lava gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Now there's something you don't see every day."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

card.name: Wall of Pine Needles
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Pine Needles.
card.flavor: The power of the forest takes a hundred forms. Some are more surprising than others.

card.name: Wall of Shields
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Banding (If any creatures with banding you control are blocking a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by.)
card.flavor:
"It's the pokey bits that hurt the most."
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

card.name: War Chariot
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I wouldn't advise using it with a Woolly Mammoth, but it's quite appropriate for many other beasts."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Warning
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
card.flavor:
"The folk of the Karplusan Mountains are impossible to ambush."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

card.name: Whalebone Glider
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 3 or less gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"It's no Ornithopter, but then I'm no Urza."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

card.name: White Scarab
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by white creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent controls a white permanent.

card.name: Whiteout
card.ability:
All creatures lose flying until end of turn.
Sacrifice a snow land: Return Whiteout from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Wiitigo
card.ability:
Wiitigo enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Wiitigo if it has blocked or been blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Any +1/+1 counter from any source can be used with his ability.

card.name: Wild Growth
card.ability:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.flavor:
"Here in Fyndhorn, where Freyalise's power is strongest, the forest has its own opinion."
—Laina of the Elvish Council
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

card.name: Wind Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
Wind Spirit can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
card.flavor:
"To visit the sky requires bravery, and thought, and little else. To master the sky requires the binding of its masters, and little else."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

card.name: Wings of Aesthir
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has flying and first strike.
card.flavor:
"For those of courage, even the sky holds no limit."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

card.name: Winter's Chill
card.ability:
Cast Winter's Chill only during combat before blockers are declared.
X can't be greater than the number of snow lands you control.
Choose X target attacking creatures. For each of those creatures, its controller may pay {1} or {2}. If that player doesn't, destroy that creature at end of combat. If that player pays only {1}, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this combat.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The payments are made when the spell resolves. The three options are: pay {2} to let creature act as normal, pay {1} to have creature neither deal or receive damage, or pay nothing and the creature does deal and receive damage but it will be destroyed at end of combat.

card.name: Withering Wisps
card.ability:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Withering Wisps.
{B}: Withering Wisps deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability no more times each turn than the number of snow Swamps you control.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Withering Wisps's triggered ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless there are no creatures on the battlefield when a turn's end step begins, and (2) the ability will do nothing if there are any creatures on the battlefield by the time the ability resolves.
10/1/2008 : If all creatures leave the battlefield during a turn's End step (after any "at the beginning of the end step" triggers would have triggered that turn), Withering Wisps will remain on the battlefield because the trigger condition has already passed.
10/1/2008 : The number of snow Swamps you control and the number of times Withering Wisps's ability has been activated so far that turn are checked each time you attempt to activate the ability.

card.name: Woolly Mammoths
card.ability: Woolly Mammoths has trample as long as you control a snow land.
card.flavor:
"Mammoths may be good to ride on, but they're certainly bad to fall off of"
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

card.name: Woolly Spider
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a Spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

card.name: Word of Blasting
card.ability: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.
card.flavor:
"Walls? What walls?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

card.name: Word of Undoing
card.ability: Return target creature and all white Auras you own attached to it to their owners' hands.
card.flavor:
"It was in Urza's journals that I finally found the secret at the core of the summonings."
—Journal, author unknown

card.name: Wrath of Marit Lage
card.ability:
When Wrath of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all red creatures.
Red creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor: Dread Marit Lage lies dreaming, not dead.

card.name: Yavimaya Gnats
card.ability:
Flying
{G}: Regenerate Yavimaya Gnats.
card.flavor:
"It is our third day of travel on the Yavimaya River, and still these creatures plague us. Davin Lansson, our naturalist, has facetiously labeled them ‘gnats,' and the name has stuck."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

card.name: Zuran Enchanter
card.ability: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.flavor:
"We are Kjeldorans no more."
—Zur the Enchanter

card.name: Zuran Orb
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: You gain 2 life.
card.flavor:
"I will go to any length to achieve my goal. Eternal life is worth any sacrifice."
—Zur the Enchanter

card.name: Zuran Spellcaster
card.ability: {T}: Zuran Spellcaster deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"A mage must be precise as well as potent; cautious, as well as clever."
—Zur the Enchanter

card.name: Zur's Weirding
card.ability:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
10/4/2004 : This is continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
10/4/2004 : If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.
4/1/2006 : When using Dredge with this, you have two choices.  You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur's Weirding's replacement.  If the latter, you first resolve Zur's Weirding's ability, then if you're going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.
